meanings.definition: (of love or friendship) intimate and affectionate but not sexual
meanings.sent1: Their platonic bond was based on mutual respect and understanding.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed their platonic relationship, knowing they were just friends.
meanings.sent3: Even though they were close, their platonic connection never crossed into romance.
meanings.sent4: Their platonic friendship was like a warm hug for the soul.
meanings.sent5: The platonic love between siblings is a special kind of bond.

meanings.definition: (of a relationship) purely spiritual and not physical
meanings.sent1: Their platonic connection transcended the physical world.
meanings.sent2: In their platonic relationship, they focused on emotional connection.
meanings.sent3: Their platonic bond was so strong, it felt like they shared a spiritual link.
meanings.sent4: The platonic relationship between mentor and student was based on wisdom and guidance.
meanings.sent5: Their platonic love was like a gentle breeze, refreshing and pure.

meanings.definition: (of a philosophy) relating to the teachings of Plato
meanings.sent1: The students delved into the platonic ideals presented in the text.
meanings.sent2: The professor's lecture focused on the platonic concepts of justice.
meanings.sent3: The platonic philosophy emphasized the pursuit of truth and knowledge.
meanings.sent4: Her understanding of the platonic principles deepened after reading Plato's works.
meanings.sent5: The platonic dialogues of Plato sparked intellectual curiosity in the students.
